entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Instruction) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicles (Driving Instruction) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010 in order to require instructors of category B+E vehicles to be registered as Approved Driving Instructors within a specified time period. The Regulations introduce a facility for disabled drivers to take the driving instruction tests in a car with automatic transmission and stipulate that if an Approved Driving Instructor passes their test in a vehicle with a automatic transmission, they can only give instruction in a vehicle with automatic transmission. The Regulations also specify the documents that are to be regarded as guidance issued by the Registrar in accordance with Article 52(4) of the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 and reduce the fee payable for submission to theory test from £72 to £66 from 28th February 2015 and to £64 from 1st October 2015.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make further provision to implement Directive 2006/126/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20th December 2006 on driving licences (“the Third Driving Licences Directive”) (O.J. L403, 30.12.2006, p. 18).

entry.title: The Plant Health (Scotland) Amendment Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health (Scotland) Order 2005 (S.S.I. 2005/613) (“the principal Order”) to transpose and implement certain EU legislation. It also makes consequential amendments to the principal Order and revokes obsolete articles in previous amending instruments.

entry.title: The Disabled Persons’ Parking Badges (Scotland) Act 2014 (Commencement) Order 2015
entry.summary: Sections 6 to 8 of the Disabled Persons’ Parking Badges (Scotland) Act 2014 came into force on 25th September 2014 (the day after that Act received Royal Assent). This Order brings the remaining provisions of that Act into force on 30th March 2015.

entry.title: The Insolvency Proceedings (Monetary Limits) (Amendment) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to Insolvency Proceedings (Monetary Limits) Order 1986.

entry.title: The Local Governance (Scotland) Act 2004 (Remuneration and Severance Payments) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Governance (Scotland) Act 2004 (Remuneration) Regulations 2007. They substitute increased annual amounts for different categories of local authority remuneration to their members. These changes are effective from 1st April 2015.

entry.title: The Disabled Persons (Badges for Motor Vehicles) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Disabled Persons (Badges for Motor Vehicles) (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (“the 2000 Regulations”). Those Regulations deal with what is known as the “blue badge” scheme.

entry.title: The Welfare Benefits Up-rating Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order is made under the Welfare Benefits Up-rating Act 2013 (“the Up-rating Act”) which provides for the up-rating of certain social security benefits and payments in various tax years.

entry.title: The Housing Benefit (Executive Determinations) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit (Executive Determinations) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 to provide for how and when the local housing allowance (“LHA”) rate is determined.

entry.title: The Public Service Pensions (2014 Act) (Commencement No.2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation certain provisions of the Public Service Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2014 (c.2). This is the second commencement order to be made under that Act.

title.div: The Education (Wales) Act 2014 (Commencement No. 3 and Saving and Transitional Provisions) Order 2015 / Gorchymyn Deddf Addysg (Cymru) 2014 (Cychwyn Rhif 3 a Darpariaethau Arbed a Throsiannol) 2015

div.p: This is the third commencement order made by the Welsh Ministers under the Education (Wales) Act 2014 (“the 2014 Act”).
Y Gorchymyn hwn yw’r trydydd gorchymyn cychwyn a wnaed gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan Ddeddf Addysg (Cymru) 2014 (“Deddf 2014”).

entry.title: The Caledonian Maritime Assets (Brodick) Harbour Revision Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order, made following an application by Caledonian Maritime Assets Limited (“CMAL”), empowers CMAL to construct, maintain and operate in the Firth of Clyde and on land at Brodick in the Island of Arran, a harbour with harbour works and harbour related facilities.

entry.title: The Capital Requirements (Capital Buffers and Macro-prudential Measures) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in part the provisions relating to systemic risk buffers at Articles 133 and 134 of Directive 2013/36/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 June 2013 on access to the activity of credit institutions and the prudential supervision of credit institutions and investment firms (OJ no L176, 27/6/2013, p. 338; for corrigenda see OJ no L208, 2/8/2013, p.73). This directive (“the capital requirements directive”) is part of a package of EU legislation commonly known as “CRD4”.

entry.title: The Neighbourhood Planning (General) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: The Localism Act 2011 (c.20) provided a statutory regime for neighbourhood planning. The Neighbourhood Planning (General) Regulations 2012 (“the 2012 Regulations”) make provision in relation to that regime. These Regulations amend the 2012 Regulations.

entry.title: The Electrically Assisted Pedal Cycles (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Electrically Assisted Pedal Cycles Regulations 1983 which prescribe the class of electrically assisted pedal cycles treated as not being a motor vehicle within the meaning of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and the Road Traffic Act 1988.

entry.title: The Sunderland City Council (Sunderland Strategic Transport Corridor – New Wear Bridge) Scheme 2014 Confirmation Instrument 2015
entry.summary: This instrument confirms a scheme to construct over the navigable waters of the River Wear a Bridge as part of the highway which they are proposing to construct/improve between the Wessington Way/Castletown Way roundabout and the Woodbine Terrace/Pallion New Road junction in the City of Sunderland.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court Adoption Rules Amendment) 2015
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt makes changes to the Sheriff Court Adoption Rules. The changes relate to the procedure to be followed where, in the course of proceedings under Part 2 of the Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”), the children’s hearing prepares a report for the court in accordance with section 95 of the 2007 Act, and where, as a result of a non-disclosure request, the children’s hearing has determined that the Reporter should give any person a redacted copy of the report.

entry.title: The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency Trading Fund Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency Trading Fund Order 2015

entry.summary: The Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency, an executive agency of the Department for Transport was established on 1st April 2014 following the merger of the Driving Standards Agency and the Vehicle and Operator Services Agency.

entry.title: The Classification, Labelling and Packaging of Chemicals (Amendments to Secondary Legislation) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend 20 statutory instruments. Regulations 1, 2 (insofar as it relates to regulation 22) and regulation 22 come into force on 31st May 2015. The remainder of the Regulations come into force on 1st June 2015. The majority of the amendments arise from changes to the legislation at European level that regulates the classification, labelling and packaging of chemicals.

entry.title: The Northumberland County Council (A1 – South East Northumberland Link Road (Morpeth Northern Bypass)) Development Consent Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order authorises Northumberland County Council (referred to in this Order as the undertaker) to construct a new single carriageway road starting at the A197 (Whorral Bank roundabout) and ending at the western end of the A1 – South East Northumberland (Morpeth Northern Bypass) at C148 (St. Leonard’s Lane) including an all movements grade separated junction connecting to the A1 Trunk road and carry out all associated works. The Order permits the undertaker to acquire compulsorily or by agreement land and rights in land and to use land for this purpose. The Order also makes provision in connection with the maintenance of the new section of highway.
